availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Tatom (Christian County, and Caldwell County, private 8th ky cav. )

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of John Tatum and Jane Tatum. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private. Died while in service at Bowling Green on April 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 288B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 612.
U.S., Registers of Deaths of Volunteers, 1861-1865, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M823, Kentucky, L-Z, p. 142.
"Josephus Tatom (1842-1863)," Find A Grave, Memorial #149357924, accessed September 23, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149357924.
